runners.name: Hardy Du Seuil
runners.comment: Quite useful; not as his best last twice; perhaps better at shorter; down in grade; chance
runners.spotlight: One-time quite useful hurdler/chaser but he hasn't run up to his best on last two runs, both over hurdles, finishing 14th of 17 in the Imperial Cup at Sandown (2m, good to soft; cheekpieces on) and last of three to one on a roll over 3m at Taunton (good to firm); has won over 2m4f (two-horse novice chase at Carlisle) but best efforts at shorter; down in grade; contender.

quotes.race: Manor Elite Horse Boxes Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've got a few things to brush up with Hardy Du Seuil's jumping but I think he's a good horse. I think he's good enough to step into graded novice company, but the handicapper can't do too much with him so it could be another novice handicap for him first - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Introducing Racing TV Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Ellison's horse is probably a three-miler and we didn't go very quick, which probably suited Hardy Du Seuil. We didn't learn anything at Wetherby, but we've learned a bit more there - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won a valuable handicap hurdle at Sandown in January 2023, but last term was a bit of a wash-out with a couple of niggly issues. He should bounce back this season. 06-11-24

He should have a nice handicap within his reach. We went chasing early with him, utilising his weight-for-age as a four-year-old, and he won a couple, but his jumping was a bit in and out, so we went back over hurdles last season. He won a decent prize at Sandown but chasing is the plan again and there's mileage in his mark. Two miles and soft ground is his bag, but I'm sure he'll stay further too. 28-09-23

runners.name: Benson
runners.comment: Formerly useful; last win was off 18lb higher; hurdles run two starts ago gives him chance
runners.spotlight: One-time useful hurdler; last win was off a mark 18lb higher at Musselburgh in January 2024 (2m4f, soft); in-and-out form over hurdles and fences since, poor effort over fences here on his latest start when 30l last of six in a novice handicap chase (2m4f, good to soft; second run after wind op); better effort when 14l sixth of ten over hurdles at Ayr on previous start (2m5f, good to soft) and has a chance judged on that run.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Hogmaneigh Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Benson was maybe beaten but he just got there. He's been called a lot of names in the past but that's twice now he's really produced the goods in this race. We've won this about five or six times in total now, so it's been a good contest for us. He'll go to the Morebattle again now, whether he runs before then I don't know - Sandy Thomson, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Morebattle Hurdle (A Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Ryan had left it late. Benson was off the bit most of the way but they all just stopped in front. I think it's hard not to run him in the Coral Cup and let him ride him. He's not the easiest and we're not used to two-mile hurdlers - Sandy Thomson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange December Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Benson's done it well, they went a gallop in front. He was a bit behind the bridle at times but that helps when it's hard work on the ground. I always had something to aim at going to the line and he's won going away nicely - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's desperately difficult to place. The ground went completely against him at Musselburgh last time and I probably shouldn't have run him. It didn't work out before that in the Fighting Fifth as there were too many runners and I don't know if we'll see him over hurdles again. He likes flat tracks and novice chases on that type of course are non-existent. He's showing us plenty at home and will go for the Frodon Novices' Handicap Chase at Musselburgh next month, when hopefully it'll be good ground. He deserves a bit of luck. 22-01-25

runners.name: Well Educated
runners.comment: Four-time course winner, latest in this race in 2024; fair run over 2m latest; contender
runners.spotlight: Has won four times here, the latest in this race off 2lb lower last year (good); hasn't been at his best after 151-day break on last two starts but perhaps found 2m too sharp for him when just over 9l third here last time (good to soft); should be spot on now and a major contender.

quotes.race: Gilcrux Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Well Educated has run well. They said he couldn't handle the soft ground but he's handled that all right. He's a grand horse who  does everything you want - George Bewley, trainer.

runners.name: See A Stride
runners.comment: Ex-Gordon Elliott; winning pointer but yet to win under rules and faces a stiff task here
runners.spotlight: Ex-Gordon Elliott; Irish point winner in 2021 but yet to win under rules; creditable second in a maiden hurdle at Carlisle in February (2m3f, good to soft) but lesser run over that same C&D back in handicap company last time; others stronger.

stable_tour.quote: She was fifth in a very messy bumper at Galway but beat the geldings on her only start between the flags. She's up to winning a bumper on soft ground, no problem. 15-11-21

runners.name: The Jewellers Pet
runners.comment: Two wins on soft/heavy at Ayr in February; good third there two runs ago; no easy task
runners.spotlight: Two wins over this trip at Ayr in February (soft/heavy); went up 16lb and, although decent third at Ayr (2m4f, good to soft) two runs back, needs to improve on his latest run at Perth (over 7l fifth in a 2m4f handicap).

6:28.race_name: Port Of Blyth Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Willie Shake Hands
runners.comment: Toughed it out to make recent winning chase debut over C&D; key player despite a 5lb rise.
runners.spotlight: Toughed it out to make a recent winning chasing debut over C&D (4-1; with Dream Jet fourth); raised 5lb since but warmed to the task on that occasion and should make his presence felt in similar conditions; key player.

runners.name: Restandbethankful
runners.comment: Below par in 2025, weakening out of contention at Kelso (2m4f) latest; easing mark.
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism at Cartmel (2m1f, soft) last August and backed that up with a solid Kelso run next time; however, he has been below par in 2025, weakening out of contention back over fences at Kelso (2m4f; beaten 24l) latest; drop back in distance and an easing mark are both helpful.

quotes.race: Breedon Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I'd love to say I gave him a peach of a ride, but Restandbethankful ran away with me. I rode him in work at home and he did exactly that, but you don't mind it when they're winning - Tommy Dowson, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran okay on his first start at Chepstow when he lacked experience. He works like he's on a decent mark and that run will have stood him in good stead. He's capable of winning on nice ground over hurdles. 21-10-21

He was a good winner over 2m at Huntingdon last time in a handicap hurdle and that form has received quite a boost with the runner-up, Zacony Rebel, bolting up last week at Ludlow by 12 lengths. There is a good handicap in two weeks' time at Musselburgh's big meeting that is his likely next assignment and off a 6lb higher mark he should continue to be competitive. 26-01-22

runners.name: Dream Jet
runners.comment: C&D winner; fourth (beaten 7l) to Willie Shake Hands over C&D recently; 6lb better off.
runners.spotlight: Winner of a four-runner C&D affair (good; from 3lb lower) last November; allowed an easy lead here recently when returning from a 162-day absence but weakened to finish only fourth (beaten 7l) to tonight's rival Willie Shake Hands; a 6lb weights turnaround gives him a shout.

quotes.race: Unibet Zero% Mission Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: That was tough. I could feel after the last fence in the back straight that the saddle was slipping. It was a test of my balance, but Dream Jet is a genuine horse and once he jumped the last I just needed him to be well balanced himself. He did it well in the end - Craig Nichol, jockey.

runners.name: Stylish Recruit
runners.comment: Point & novice hurdle winner; poor form since wind surgery; best watched back over fences.
runners.spotlight: Point winner who also made all in a 2m novice hurdle here (20-1) last June; fortunes have dipped markedly since wind surgery, pulling up twice over fences and making no impact over hurdles at Newcastle or Ayr (both 2m4f); easing mark but best watched on return to fences.

stable_tour.quote: He won a novice hurdle at Hexham nicely in the summer and then didn't back it up at Carlisle, but we later found a problem. It's been sorted now and he'll go back over fences, probably on a flat track. We're looking forward to him. 22-01-25

runners.name: Sonning
runners.comment: Well beaten in a 2m selling hurdle latest; visor applied for second chase start; unlikely.
runners.spotlight: No win since November 2022 and he's struggled for form in recent starts, joining this trainer for the last three and well beaten in a 2m selling hurdle here on latest; visor applied for just his second attempt - last of five in the other - over fences; unlikely candidate.

stable_tour.quote: I don't think he quite got a mile and a half on the Flat but mile - and - a - quarter horses should get two over hurdles and he's a little bit stronger as well now. He was second on his hurdling debut at Wincanton where he was a little novicey but will have learned plenty. 03-11-21

runners.name: She Wont Mind
runners.owner: Paul Davies John Raglan Beswick Brothers
runners.comment: Weakened quickly in an uncompetitive 2m maiden hurdle (25-1) latest; rules chasing debut.
runners.spotlight: Point winner in May 2023; yet to show much under rules (0-7), weakening quickly in an uncompetitive 2m maiden here (25-1) 17 days ago; the switch to fences under rules could suit but it will still come as a surprise if she's good enough; 1lb out of the handicap.

runners.name: Cest Quelquun
runners.comment: Three chase wins; third on last three starts, the latest over C&D; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner who has finished third on his last three starts, the latest behind Kicksaftersix (who's now 6lb worse off) over C&D this month (good to soft); each-way chance.

quotes.race: Majestic Hotel Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: C'Est Quelqu'un's owners are local and it's really nice to get a winner here for them. He is lowly rated and will be kept to similar contests. Jack did really well to stay on him at the last - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.name: Robert Dores
runners.comment: Two wins were here over hurdles; only chase completion was a 2nd here in May 2023.
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been here (2m7f/3m) over hurdles, the latest off a 3lb lower mark 17 days ago; failed to complete the course on four of his five runs over fences (best run was a C&D second on debut in May 2023); bit to prove.

runners.name: Kicksaftersix
runners.comment: On a hat-trick having won C&D chases on last two starts; up another 5lb; should go well
runners.spotlight: Has won his last two races, both over C&D, the latest this month when several of today's rivals were behind him; up another 5lb but should go well again.

runners.name: Dr Shirocco
runners.comment: Two chase wins last term, the first over C&D in May; not in top form recently; a possible
runners.spotlight: Two chase wins last season, the first over C&D in May and the second at Musselburgh in November (3m, good to soft); not in such good form in two races won by Kickaftersix recently but could bounce back.

runners.name: Rob Roy Macgregor
runners.comment: Mixed form last term; sound chase debut when fourth to Kicksaftersix over C&D; a possible
runners.spotlight: Mixed form last season but decent first run over fences when fourth to Kicksaftersix (who's now 6lb worse off) over C&D this month; needs to brush up on his jumping; a possible.

stable_tour.quote: He's a Walk In The Park and has not been the easiest to train. We've never worked him too hard at home as we were worried we might just blow his head a bit. It's been about getting him on a racecourse and his bumper form looks good. He won first time at Carlisle and shouldn't really have gone to Hexham after that as the course didn't really suit him. I was desperate to get another run into him because of his temperament. He pulled hard on his hurdle debut at Kelso but he jumped really well and we were delighted with his performance. Two miles will be a bit sharp for him but we might stay there to get him to settle. We won't be in a great hurry, he might have another run before Christmas and we'll see where we are in the new year. His bumper form was very good and he is exciting. 15-11-23

runners.name: Halfway House Lad
runners.comment: In good form over fences this spring with two wins and C&D second to Kicksaftersix; chance
runners.spotlight: In good form over fences this spring, winning a handicap at Newcastle (2m7f, good to soft) and a novice handicap over C&D (good to soft) before finishing second to Kickasaftersix on good ground over C&D last month (beaten four and a half lengths but now 10lb better off); chance.

runners.name: Donnys Fortune
runners.comment: Two UK point wins on firm; fair chase debut when 5th at Uttoxeter latest; should improve
runners.spotlight: Two wins in UK points, both on firm, in 2023-24; mixed form under rules but creditable fifth on chase debut at Uttoxeter last time; improvement likely.

runners.name: Muroor
runners.comment: 2-40 over fences; fair run when 5l fifth to Kicksaftersix over C&D last time; place chance
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is 2-40 over fences; fair run when 5l fifth to Kicksaftersix over C&D last time (good to soft); place chance.

quotes.race: hannontravel.com Most Appropriately Dressed Lady Win A Trip To The Dominican Republic Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: He jumped very quick and was lightning for a small horse. I thought at the weight he would run well, not as well as those who backed him, I don't know where that [money] came from. He's just a real specialist for up here - Tom McCourt, trainer

quotes.race: Portman Dentalcare Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Muroor loves it up here and Conor [Maxwell] has him down to a tee. He has plenty of ability and tracks like this suit him - Tom McCourt, trainer

quotes.race: Ulster Carpets Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Muroor loves these type of tracks. He's getting it together. There's another meeting here next month and he might come back, the stiff finish here suits him. Last day was a real sickener but it's great to get this one - Tom McCourt, trainer.

quotes.race: Stoat Selling Stakes
quotes.quote: The other horse brought me across but I just had to try and keep Muroor going. He's a little bit quirky but he's won in the end. I was pretty sure I'd got up - Jamie Spencer, rider.

runners.name: Lady Hamilton

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mr A Lister

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden; fell four out when in touch over C&D last time on second chase start
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden; fell four out when in touch in race won by Kicksaftersix here last time (3m, good to soft) on second run over fences.

6:58.race_name: Port Of Blyth Novices' Handicap Chase

runners.name: Classical Sting
runners.comment: Cheekpieces replace hood; bred to be suited by switch to fences, so needs market scrutiny.
runners.spotlight: Some improvement over hurdles but still failed to make a significant impact when beaten 28l (eighth of 14) in a 2m maiden at Huntingdon in January last time; a hood (worn last time) is replaced by cheekpieces; bred to be suited by a switch to fences, so merits market scrutiny.

runners.name: Royal Deeside
runners.comment: Mixed messages, mostly on the Flat, since joining this trainer; 0-3 over fences.
runners.spotlight: 23-race maiden; shaped okay at Market Rasen (2m1f, good to soft; third on second attempt over fences) in January on final start for Alan King; mixed messages, mostly on the Flat, since joining this trainer and heavily eased in the Chester Plate (80-1) latest; risky.

stable_tour.quote: He was placed nearly every run over hurdles last season, he's strengthened over the summer and, although I was rather disappointed with him at Plumpton two runs ago he did run much better at Warwick on Tuesday. His trip is 2m, to start with at least. 07-11-24

runners.name: Rock N Roll Champ
runners.comment: Maiden pointer; hasn't achieved much in six starts over hurdles; rules chasing debut.
runners.spotlight: Maiden pointer; hasn't achieved much in six starts over hurdles either, only a modest fourth over 2m here (40-1) on penultimate start; kicks off over fences at a realistic level but quickfire improvement is needed.

runners.name: Time Was
runners.comment: Still seeking first win under rules (0-13) but has shown glimpses of ability; a possible.
runners.spotlight: Point winner; rules maiden (0-13) who has shown glimpses of ability over fences, none more so than when second at Wetherby (2m3f, soft; 18-1) in February; last of the three to finish at Huntingdon recently; possibilities.

runners.name: Am Still Here
runners.comment: Went under over C&D in protracted tussle on chase debut; obvious chance despite 2lb rise.
runners.spotlight: Twice runner-up over hurdles, including here (2m) in March in first-time cheekpieces; bettered that on RPRs when going under in a protracted tussle on recent chasing debut over C&D (4-1); obvious chance, despite 2lb rise, if able to replicate that performance.

runners.name: Deep Strato

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Corbridge point winner (2m4f); essentially disappointing since switched to rules (0-8).
runners.spotlight: Corbridge point winner (2m4f) for Brian Harding; essentially disappointing since switched to racing under rules and has lacked for fluency in two attempts over fences; competes from an easing mark in a weak race.

runners.name: Iturgeon Du Breuil
runners.breeder: Dr V Denis Hubert & Mr Eric Helye
runners.comment: 0-15 under rules; fair hurdles form here; fences - pulled up twice previously - the risk.
runners.spotlight: Maiden (0-15 under rules); has run some of his better races at this track, beaten a neck in a 3m hurdle (good) last May and a respectable fourth on latest start; back in trip for the return to fences - pulled up twice previously - with neither of those factors looking ideal.

runners.name: Chantilly Rose
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D Futter & Mrs R Patterson
runners.comment: 12-race maiden; new headgear combination is tried; other runners are far more appealing.
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden; beaten a combined total of 157l over hurdles in last three starts and fell at the first on her last attempt over fences; new headgear combination is tried; other runners are far more appealing.

5:58.race_name: Tynedale Agricultural Society Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Maxs Champ
runners.breeder: S A R L De Chambure & Mrs L & D Ades
runners.comment: Winning Irish pointer; first hurdles win when back up to 2m7f last time; possible
runners.spotlight: Winning Irish pointer; off the mark on 11th hurdle start on return to this trip to win a novice handicap at Uttoxeter last time (good); tongue-tie and blinkers were back on that day and he wears them again here; 5lb higher, but a possible.

runners.name: Powers Dilemma
runners.comment: Maiden; creditable 3rd with cheekpieces on chase debut here last time; headgear retained
runners.spotlight: Yet to win over hurdles; creditable third of five in a 3m handicap on chase debut here in first-time cheekpieces off this mark last time (good to soft); headgear retained now back hurdling.

runners.name: Rumble B
runners.comment: 3-39 over hurdles; last win was over C&D in March 2024 but he has a sound each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-39 over hurdles, latest win coming over C&D in March 2024 (heavy); placed on last five starts, last time beaten just over 2l in third to Tartan Cookie (who's now 2lb worse off) over C&D (good); solid each-way contender.

runners.name: Man Of Action
runners.comment: Hard to fancy on h'cap hurdle debut having shown modest form; tailed off over C&D latest
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; unexposed but hard to fancy on this handicap hurdle debut having shown modest form in three runs over hurdles, last time 43l fourth of eight in a C&D maiden (good).

runners.name: Tartan Cookie

prev_owners.owner: W J E Scott & Mrs M A Scott

runners.comment: Off the mark over C&D last time; closely matched with Rumble B (3rd) on that form; player
runners.spotlight: Had Rumble B (now 2lb better off) two and a half lengths back in third when getting off the mark over hurdles over C&D last time (good; 3lb out of the handicap, tongue-tie back on) having shown very little on his three previous starts following a 531-day break; runs off 3lb higher but should be competitive again.

runners.name: Somebodys Fortune
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs T P Winnell
runners.comment: 3m2f mares' h'cap winner last May (first-time visor); poor efforts since; blinkers on now
runners.spotlight: Won a Kelso mares' handicap hurdle off 4lb higher last May (3m2f, good to soft) when visored for the first time; has shown very little on her four subsequent outings and blinkers are now tried; others preferred.

quotes.race: Five Star Taxis Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Somebody's Fortune was disappointing a couple of times but we didn't understand her and probably ran her at the wrong track. She'll probably jump a fence one day and I think her point-to-point form has worked out good enough. She's tough and she jumps well enough - Peter Scudamore, trainer's partner and assistant, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Mademewhatiam
runners.comment: 0-9; creditable stable debut when 5th over C&D when back after wind op latest; a possible
runners.spotlight: Ex-Paul Nolan/Mark Walford; maiden who ran a creditable race when fifth over C&D (good to soft; pulled hard) on stable debut last time on first run after wind op; now 2lb lower; a possible.

runners.name: Dakota Beat
runners.comment: Conditions suit, but well beaten since back from 230-day break and is hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: These conditions suit but he has been well beaten on his three runs since returning from a 230-day break and is hard to fancy.

quotes.race: September 6th Celebration Race Meeting (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: It's possible he could go for a winners' bumper. The owners (Mark Murray and Grant Harrison) are from the north of England, and he could go to Hexham in a couple of weeks - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's been knocking on the door but is still a maiden over hurdles and he'll probably struggle to win a maiden at this time of the year. We're giving him a break until next year and hopefully he can pick up a race in the spring or summer. 19-11-20

runners.name: Addosh
runners.comment: 7lb penalty for recent Sedgefield win but scored off 13lb higher in the summer of 2022
runners.spotlight: Having only her fourth start for the yard when winning at Sedgefield (2m1f, good to firm) a week ago; has a 7lb penalty to carry but is still 13lb lower than for her previous win over hurdles in the summer of 2022, so she is much respected.

runners.name: Wolfburg

prev_owners.owner: G R Orchard And Annie Mania

runners.comment: Won at Catterick in February last year but has shown nothing in three handicaps since
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden hurdle at Catterick (2m, soft) in February last year but has shown nothing in just three handicap starts since; best watched for now.

stable_tour.quote: He came back from his last run at Carlisle with a bit of an injury, so he's had some time off. He'll be back in work shortly and we'll keep him hurdling now. He needs a bit of time between his races. He was good in a bumper and very good the day he won over hurdles at Catterick last season and you can probably give him excuses for some of his other runs, which have been disappointing. He'll be a cracking novice chaser next season. 22-01-25

runners.name: Gemini Man
runners.comment: Pulled up on handicap debut at Perth last month and now 0-23 under rules; look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Placed in a couple of Musselburgh maiden hurdles on good to soft ground (2m/2m1f) earlier in year but pulled up on handicap debut at Perth (2m, good to soft) last month; now 0-23 under rules; best to look elsewhere.

runners.name: Socks Off
runners.comment: 2-29 under rules, but third as hurdler on last two starts; each-way possibilities again
runners.spotlight: 2-29 under rules and no win since the start of 2023; third on good ground at Newcastle (2m1f) and Carlisle (2m3f) in his last two starts, though, and each-way possibilities again.

stable_tour.quote: He won for us at Sedgefield around this time last year and was then a little bit unfortunate on a couple of occasions. He'll be competitive off his mark and the plan is to mix between hurdles and fences over the summer. 24-01-24

runners.name: Allbetsoff

prev_owners.owner: New Vision Bloodstock & G B Walford

runners.comment: C&D winner; claimed after finishing fourth in a C&D seller last time; enough to prove
runners.spotlight: Two wins for Mark Walford last summer included one over C&D (heavy, has won on good) but not so good since; latest fourth of nine here came in a seller (claimed for £6,000); enough to prove on debut for new stable.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap Hurdle (Go North Sea Pigeon Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I thought Allbetsoff was badly handicapped but he didn't look so there and will go up a bit for that. He did it well, he's grown with confidence and his jumping's got better. That was a good performance - Mark Walford, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing

runners.name: Serious Ego
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner but all five wins have come on soft/heavy; hasn't shone lately
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner but all five wins have come on soft/heavy ground and the veteran hasn't shone in his last four outings; others are more convincing.

quotes.race: Download The N-E Bet App Today Handicap Hurdle (Go North Sea Pigeon Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Serious Ego loves that ground. He spent a good twelve months and we couldn't find it for him, there was no heavy ground anywhere, but he's had it twice and proven himself twice this season. He tried hard today, he had a smooth passage and he's won well - Conor Rabbitt, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Leopardstown May Family Day Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Serious Ego was helped by me riding him wide on the track. It helped him a lot. It's good to see him win because we thought a bit of him early in the year but everything has to fall right for him - Davy Russell, rider

runners.name: Cage Rattler
runners.comment: Has shown some ability and the return to this trip may help; worth a second look
runners.spotlight: 1-23 under rules and 0-6 over hurdles but he has shown some ability and the return to this trip may help; worth a second look.

quotes.race: Goresbridge Handicap
quotes.quote: Cage Rattler found the trip a bit short for him at the Curragh last day but we were more confident today. He is still green and he will improve again. He handles a dig in the ground - John Kinsella, trainer.

runners.name: Huit Reflets
runners.comment: Sole win in 25 starts came over C&D off this mark; has gone well fresh before; interesting
runners.spotlight: 1-25 under rules but the win came off this mark over C&D (good) last summer; not seen in 256 days but he has gone well fresh before and the stable won this last year; interesting.

stable_tour.quote: He's had four runs since we purchased him in Ireland and he's been third, third, second and second - including last time out at Hexham behind Halpha Soleil. He looks certain to be getting his head in front soon as the first three at Hexham came a long way clear - he just bumped into one there. 14-06-24

runners.name: Grand Scheme
runners.comment: Won by 15l at Southwell eight days ago; 7lb penalty shouldn't preclude another big effort
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner (1m-1m6f) for Richard Hannon; having only his fifth start over hurdles when scoring by 15l at Southwell (2m, good) eight days ago; 7lb penalty shouldn't preclude another big effort.

quotes.race: Follow @BetVictor On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Grand Scheme loves the track and will get further, no question. Pat gave him a lovely ride - Richard Hannon, trainer.

runners.name: Likleman
runners.comment: 1-29 under rules; virtually bolted on stable debut at Newcastle; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: 1-29 under rules, the win coming on the Flat at Hamilton (1m4f) last September; tailed off after doing far too much early on stable debut at Newcastle (2m1f, good) in March; hard to fancy despite the application of a tongue-tie.

runners.name: Blended Stealth
runners.breeder: R D And Mrs J S Chugg
runners.owner: D Mullen, G Barker And Partners
runners.comment: 0-35 under rules; hard to recommend in returning cheepieces
runners.spotlight: 1lb lower than when beaten a head over C&D (good) in November, but a long way below that form since and now 0-35 under rules; hard to recommend in returning cheepieces.

runners.name: Edmond Dantes
runners.comment: Very poor over hurdles and fences since the summer of 2023; 7lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner for David Menuisier in his younger days and beaten just a head off a mark of 82 over C&D (good) in the summer of 2023, but very poor over hurdles and fences since; 7lb out of the weights.

7:58.race_name: Northumberland County Show Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Pike Road
runners.comment: Made all, in a canter, in a 3m maiden here (good) ten days ago; ought to defy the penalty.
runners.spotlight: Made all, in a canter, in a 3m maiden here (good) ten days ago; that was due reward for a series of consistent efforts and, under the same 10lb claimer Freddie Keighley, he ought to prove capable of defying a penalty over a shorter trip against similarly modest opposition.

runners.name: Wild Reiver
runners.comment: Soundly beaten - by 56l and 57l respectively - in two novice hurdles at Kelso (2m2f-2m5f).
runners.spotlight: Beaten by 56l and 57l in two novice hurdles at Kelso (2m2f-2m5f); no reason to anticipate a sharp upturn in fortunes.

runners.name: Late Night Drama
runners.comment: Former pointer (0-5); always behind and tailed off on rules debut at Perth (2m4f; 80-1).
runners.spotlight: Former pointer (0-5); always behind and tailed off on rules debut at Perth (2m4f, good to soft; 80-1) under four weeks ago; stablemate of Theatre Light.

runners.name: Miss Bumblebee
runners.comment: Found one rival stronger in two Dromahane points (3m) prior to joining this trainer.
runners.spotlight: Found one rival stronger in two Dromahane points (3m) prior to joining this trainer; her maiden dam was a sister to the bumper and useful 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase winner Macs Flamingo, so there's scope to think she can develop into a hurdler; the forecast option.

runners.name: Moveonbuy
runners.comment: Modest form, beaten 30l (fourth of seven; 150-1) over 2m4f at Carlisle latest.
runners.spotlight: Modest form, earning an RPR of 73 when beaten 30l (fourth of seven; 150-1) over 2m4f at Carlisle last time on second attempt over hurdles; eligibility for a handicap mark is looming on the horizon.

runners.name: Theatre Light
runners.comment: Encouraging rules debut at Carlisle; took a sharp backward step at Perth (beaten 133l).
runners.spotlight: Point winner in November 2023; kept on when runner-up in a maiden on rules and stable debut at Carlisle (2m4f, good; 13-2) but took a sharp backward step at Perth (beaten 133l) subsequently; stablemate of Late Night Drama.

runners.name: Waltzing Matilda
runners.comment: Always behind when 150-1 for Wetherby rules debut (2m4f, good).
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in points without winning; always behind when 150-1 for Wetherby rules debut (2m4f, good) two months ago.

runners.name: Dartmouth Star
runners.comment: Well beaten in a bumper and hung right when toiling in 2m maiden here (beaten 55l; 80-1).
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on sole bumper start (Wetherby) and hung right when toiling in a 2m maiden here (beaten 55l; 80-1) 17 days ago.

7:40.race_name: PricedUp Daily Sports Boosts Handicap Hurdle
7:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered)

runners.name: Lihyan
runners.comment: Worth considering after a solid effort back from wind surgery at a higher level last time.
runners.spotlight: 5-23 over hurdles and his recent run when an 11l eighth of 11 in a competitive Haydock Class 2 after wind surgery was solid; only 1lb higher than his most recent win in October and likely to make his presence felt now back down in class.

quotes.race: Sign Up To Our Newsletter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lihyan is not overly big but is well put together and came on leaps and bounds from the last day. He jumped far better today which was one of the goals we got right - Josh Halley, trainer

stable_tour.quote: The change to waiting tactics and a step up in trip have been the key to him. He's won three races over hurdles for us this season. If the ground is decent he could go for the conditional jockeys' race at Aintree, a 0-130 hurdle over 3m on October 27. He should get the strong gallop he needs there and he's certainly capable of winning a better pot than he's been playing for. Now we know he stays, the 3m races at Musselburgh will be ideal for him when the ground goes soft elsewhere. 16-10-24

runners.name: Press Your Luck
runners.comment: On a good mark but he's been out of form since returning from a long absence.
runners.spotlight: A five-time winner over hurdles but he's been struggling to recapture that level of form since returning from a long absence; has come a long way down the weights but others make more immediate appeal.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Newbury Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Press Your Luck won over fences at Chepstow in October but then lost his bottle. He went to Wetherby and he didn't want to know; he whipped round at the start. His jumping was appalling next time at Exeter and, for whatever reason, the horse got his confidence back today and loved that. He'll stay over hurdles for the time being and I think he enjoyed the small field. He's a good horse when things go right - Chris Gordon, trainer.

quotes.race: Tom Malone Bloodstock Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I questioned if Press Your Luck would enjoy it today, he's a very sensitive horse. We tried him in cheekpieces once and he downed tools so things have to go his way. He had been much more comfortable when we'd schooled him and he's got the scope. He really enjoyed it today and we'll go back and work out where to go. He's a real nice prospect and I'll imagine he'll stay well - Chris Gordon, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've been a bit obsessed with Press Your Luck and a small field, so I wanted Jamie to give him plenty of space on the outside, which he's done beautifully. That's more of the horse I see at home. I put cheekpieces on him in the Lanzarote and he sulked. He took exception to them, so we've taken them off and gone back to square one. He got his confidence back at Wincanton. There might be something at Aintree, but I'm keen to give him a run over fences as soon as the new season starts and before he goes out in the field. He's happier on good ground - Chris Gordon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him from Donnacha having won a point-to-point in Ireland 12 months ago. He had his first run for us at Kempton in the spring, where he was given an ideal introduction in a 2m bumper. He learned a lot from that race and then enjoyed a long summer off. He has a very likeable attitude and I felt his work had been encouraging enough to expect a good run on his hurdling debut at Newton Abbot last month. He did not let us down, winning nicely and is clearly going the right way. There is a 2m1f novice hurdle at Fontwell that would be a nice next race for him and I would be hopeful of him stepping up again on that effort as he still very inexperienced. 11-11-20

runners.name: Kitesurfer
runners.comment: Will need to improve again to defy his revised mark but he remains open to progress.
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over hurdles last season (2m7f-3m2f, good/good to soft); returned to form back from a break with a win at Ludlow last month under a 3lb claimer and effectively 7lb higher here with Gavin Sheehan back in the saddle; will need to improve again but he's open to further progress.

stable_tour.quote: I was disappointed with his debut for us because he'd been working stylishly - maybe he takes more graft and wasn't fit enough. Harry Whittington had him last season and liked him. He should be all right. 15-11-23

This chap came from Harry Whittington and is by a sire who is becoming quite popular. He won a juvenile hurdle in France but picked up an injury so Harry had an interrupted time with him last season, which was limited to one run at Kempton where he was fourth behind Russian Ruler. He goes nicely and jumps well so could easily be one to have some fun with. 28-09-23

runners.name: Briefly
runners.comment: Not yet fully exposed and worth considering should her stamina hold up.
runners.spotlight: Just touched off by an improver at Wincanton in February and bounced straight back from a modest effort when a good second off this mark at Ascot (3m, good) the following month, ridden by Chad Bament; one of two runners for the stable and, should she stay this far, will likely be in the mix.

runners.name: Dear Ralphy
runners.comment: Consistent 9yo who was only just denied last time and another bold bid can be expected.
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent 9yo who was only just denied at Fontwell (3m2f, good) 13 days ago, staying on well late in a first-time visor; one of two for the Anthony Honeyball stable and likely to give another good account off a small rise in the same headgear.

7:10.race_name: Download The PricedUp App Handicap Chase
7:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered)

runners.name: Shadows In The Sky

prev_owners.owner: D & D Armstrong Ltd & L Westwood

runners.comment: Made a successful stable debut at Uttoxeter on Saturday; respected despite 7lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; pulled up in his first three starts of the year, but bounced right back to form (having been backed to do so) when successful on stable debut at Uttoxeter (2m5f, good) on Saturday; that wasn't much of a jumping test with several fences omitted, but he is still respected despite the 7lb penalty.

runners.name: Jeudidee
runners.comment: 0-8 in handicaps but made an encouraging return at Warwick last month; form since boosted
runners.spotlight: Dual novice hurdle winner in 2023 and 0-8 since handicapping over hurdles and fences, but he made an encouraging return from 161 days off when third of seven at Warwick (2m, good) last month (runner-up has won twice since); worth another go over a trip he should stay on breeding; interesting.

quotes.race: Exeter Season Opener Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jeudidee loves top of the ground and probably ran a better race when third at Uttoxeter last week than he did today, as that was very competitive on softer ground than he wanted. He's a nice horse at this time of year and loves his jumping. Providing he's all right in the next ten days, we'll definitely see him again soon. He wants good ground and places like Wincanton will suit him. It was his first time right-handed today and you could see he'll learn from that, but he has a nice future - Kim Bailey, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Calvic
runners.comment: C&D winner; a long way behind Cloudy Wednesday last time; has had a wind op; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who has dropped 3lb below his last winning mark, but modest in two starts since returning in March as when around 40l behind Cloudy Wednesday at Fakenham (3m, good) last month; has undergone wind surgery since then and interesting to see how he fares with a first-time tongue-tie joining the cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The drying ground is the important thing. We may step Calvic up in trip on the back at that, especially on that ground - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

runners.name: Cloudy Wednesday
runners.comment: 10lb higher than when winning this race in 2023, but comes here in good form; high on list
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; 10lb higher than when successful in this race two years ago but just 4lb higher than when winning for the third time at Fakenham (3m, good) last month and only just beaten off 1lb lower at Market Rasen (2m5f, good) 11 days ago; not sure to enjoy an uncontested lead this time, but still high on the list.

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Cloudy Wednesday likes this ground and it's done nothing but rain until now. He's had a busy time so I might give him a break after that - Caroline Fryer, trainer.

runners.name: Jassur Des Brosses
runners.comment: 0-13 under rules; comes up against some in-form rivals on chase debut; others preferred
runners.spotlight: 0-13 under rules; ran well when fourth of 14 over hurdles in first-time blinkers (now removed) here (2m5f, good) last month (winner has gone in again since), but he comes up against some in-form rivals on chase debut; others preferred.

runners.name: Prospect House
runners.owner: Hard Held Partnership And Angus Racing
runners.comment: Made all at Market Rasen last time; longer trip and other front-runners are the concern
runners.spotlight: Both wins at Market Rasen, the latest when making all in a first-time visor over fences (2m1f, good) last month; 4lb rise less of a concern than the longer trip and presence of other front-runners.

8:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered)

runners.name: Doc Mccoy

prev_owners.owner: Ian Chanin, Tom Hooper, Peter Kingwell & Mark Booth

runners.comment: Made a successful return to hurdles at Fakenham last month; should go well again
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in October 2023 and made a successful return to hurdles when beating three rivals at Fakenham (2m4f, good) last month; only 2lb higher and should go well again.

quotes.race: Premier League Offers At Rhino.Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a shame Doc McCoy didn't win his bumper, but he has always been a proper jumper. He is an embryonic chaser as he won a point-to-point at Great Trethew. He bowled along in front when he won his point-to-point so we thought we would let him bowl along and make it a test. We could aim him at the EBF Final at Sandown in March. That  is probably his kind of race as it suits proper staying chasers. That will probably be his target - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his hurdling debut before finishing fourth under a penalty, but he picked up an injury soon afterwards. He's back from a break and will go novice chasing. 06-11-24

Novice hurdling is the plan for him and he jumps well, while he performed to a good level in his bumpers, finishing in the places on all three starts. It was a shame he didn't win one, but Datsalrightgino didn't either. 28-09-23

runners.name: Ikigai Star
runners.comment: Won twice over 2m on good ground last year, but again this sort of trip begs a question
runners.spotlight: Won twice over hurdles (2m, good) last year including one here; showed up well for a long way on his return from 128 days off at Market Rasen (2m3f, good) last month, but again this sort of trip begs a question.

runners.name: Star Legend
runners.comment: Dual hurdles winner, but this trip in a small field may not be a sufficient stamina test
runners.spotlight: Both hurdle wins at Fakenham, the latest in December (2m7f, good to soft); won over 1m6f on the AW at Chelmsford in March, but this trip in a small field may not be a sufficient stamina test for him now.

stable_tour.quote: He was quite a shock winner at Fakenham last time but he'd just dropped into a lower grade. He does really well around Fakenham, which is really nice as it's a track I love supporting. We've just set up a syndicate to sell him to more local people, which will mean he'll keep running at local tracks like Fakenham and Huntingdon. 01-01-25

runners.name: Land Girls Luck
runners.comment: Caught the eye of the stewards last time; interesting up in trip in returning cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Won a Sedgefield maiden hurdle (2m1f, good; first-time cheekpieces) last month but well held in two handicaps since, albeit her latest Worcester performance was the subject of a running and riding inquiry; doesn't look an easy ride, but stepping back up in trip in the returning headgear makes her interesting.

quotes.race: Visit The New betvickers.com Website Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Land Girl's Luck ran in a three-runner race at Exeter recently and did her best work late on, so we just thought over two miles we'll ride her really positively and let her use her jumping, because she jumps really well even though she's not the biggest. Max [Comley, trainer] thought the cheekpieces would help and they made a big difference - David Bass, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

6:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered)

runners.name: Arcon
runners.comment: French AW winner in 2023; stayed well on the Flat and worth considering on hurdle debut.
runners.spotlight: French AW winner in October 2023; yet to improve on that effort on these shores but he did go close when second of five at Newcastle (2m) in October and was probably unsuited by the soft ground on his next run; returns from a 208-day break but he stayed well on the Flat and is worth considering in an ordinary contest on hurdle debut.

runners.name: High Court Judge
runners.comment: Left behind a modest hurdle debut when fourth at Worcester two weeks ago, fading late.
runners.spotlight: Eight-time AW winner (1m-1m4f) who left behind a modest hurdle debut when a promising fourth of 11 at Worcester (2m, good) two weeks ago, fading late; one of two runners for James Owen.

runners.name: Velvet Vulcan
runners.comment: Well held on hurdle debut and never figured back on the AW latest; more needed.
runners.spotlight: 1m4f AW classified winner in February 2024 but he was far too free when well held on March's hurdle debut at Warwick (2m5f, good) after wind surgery and never threatened back on the AW last time; more probably needed but the drop back in trip could help.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: We're very happy for owner-breeder Richard Marriott and his broodmare Battery Power. Velvet Vulcan is now the fourth winner from the mare from four runners - Michael Keady, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Lennemi
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Ten-race maiden on the Flat and makes hurdle/stable debut with stamina to prove.
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden at up to 1m2f but he was a close second of 12 at Newcastle (1m, AW) in January before a lesser effort back there in March on final start for Julie Camacho; makes hurdle/stable debut with stamina to prove back from nearly three months off.

runners.name: Noisy Jazz
runners.comment: 1m Flat winner; has stamina in her pedigree and could play a major role on hurdle debut.
runners.spotlight: Flat winner at Newmarket (1m, good) on August debut but she's yet to build on that (too free latest); however, she has stamina in her pedigree and, if the hood helps her settle, she could play a major role on hurdle debut.

runners.name: Venus Slipper
runners.comment: In good form on the AW earlier this year but stamina is a concern on hurdle debut.
runners.spotlight: In good form earlier in the year on the AW, winning in February (1m2f) and going close the following month, although her latest two efforts haven't been so encouraging; makes hurdle debut but stamina for this trip is a concern.

6:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered)

runners.name: Little Soiree
runners.comment: Would have likely been placed latest but for interference and difficult to rule out.
runners.spotlight: Went very close to losing her maiden status three runs ago but hasn't really kicked on from that, although she did meet interference last time at Plumpton where she would have likely been placed when ridden by Freddie Gordon; dropped 2lb and difficult to rule out.

stable_tour.quote: She got beaten a head at Plumpton last week when she got collared on the line by one of Anthony Honeyball's with a 10lb claimer. She made a bad mistake at the last down the back, which probably cost her the race. That was painful but it was good to see her back in form. I want to find her an ideal race, a 0-100 handicap over 2m on better ground, and fingers crossed she should be thereabouts. 26-02-25

runners.name: Alvesta
runners.comment: Has made a promising start over hurdles and makes handicap debut off a workable mark.
runners.spotlight: Made a promising start to her hurdle career when a close second of three at Huntingdon (2m, good) in April and improved on that when fourth in a deeper Warwick maiden two weeks ago; lacks experience in this code but makes handicap debut off a workable mark.

runners.name: Window Of Time
runners.comment: Fitness to prove but she's shown enough to suggest a race of this nature is within her.
runners.spotlight: In the first three on good ground over hurdles on her last four starts, all at 2m, and shaped promisingly off this mark on November's handicap debut when just under a 5l third of 13 at Southwell; wouldn't need to improve on that too much to figure if ready to roll on first start since.

runners.name: Darting Rose
runners.comment: Latest run back from a break was encouraging and has place claims if building on that.
runners.spotlight: From a successful family for this stable but she's yet to really shine in five starts over hurdles, although her latest run in November (2m, good) when returning from a break was more encouraging (second run in handicaps); another absence to overcome but she has each-way claims if building on that.

runners.name: Malinka
runners.breeder: Jan Krauze & S A S Stratfin

prev_owners.owner: G C Myddelton & V E C Taylor

runners.comment: Cartmel winner in August but not so good since and hopes pinned on the fitting of a visor.
runners.spotlight: Won at Cartmel on stable debut in August but has failed to match that level since and her latest effort back from a break was underwhelming; visor now goes on and she's down in the weights but she has a bit to prove at present.

stable_tour.quote: She won at odds of 12-1 at Cartmel on the day we got the treble and she was third last time at Sedgefield. She's rated 96 and will run in a mares' handicap hurdle at Leicester on Thursday. She'll definitely want ease in the ground. 05-12-24

runners.name: Remarkable Flight
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Hasn't kicked on from her win in March but took a step back in the right direction latest.
runners.spotlight: Low-grade mares' handicap winner at Fakenham in March (2m, good to soft) off 3lb lower but she hasn't kicked on from that in four runs since, although her latest fourth at Market Rasen (2m, good) 11 days ago was a step back in the right direction.

runners.name: Lady Buttercup
runners.comment: Has shown little in four starts over hurdles, including on handicap debut last time.
runners.spotlight: A good-ground bumper winner in September but she's shown little in four starts over hurdles, including on handicap debut last time; needs to turn things around.

8:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered)

runners.name: Coolagh Park
runners.comment: Prolific in points and he looks the one to beat.
runners.spotlight: Failed to win for Gordon Elliott but has done well for this stable in points, winning five of his ten starts; his only previous run in a hunter chase resulted in a heavy defeat at Cheltenham a year ago but that was a much stronger race than this and he looks the one to beat.

runners.name: Dr Lockdown
runners.comment: Beaten 68l when third at Hexham 10 days ago; has too much to find on these terms.
runners.spotlight: Achieved little when winning a two-runner point in April and was beaten 68l when third at Hexham 10 days ago; has too much to prove.

runners.name: Kilfilum Woods
runners.comment: Fair maiden hurdler/chaser who has taken well to points; respected.
runners.spotlight: Fair maiden hurdler/chaser for Paul Webber and he's taken well to points for this stable, winning four of his six completed starts, most recently ridden by Clara Brewitt; looks sure to give another good account back under rules with conditions to suit.

runners.name: Right Hand Of God

prev_owners.owner: Galloping On The South Downs Partnership

runners.comment: A three-time winner in points who has the ability to figure on hunter chase debut.
runners.spotlight: Displayed ability over hurdles/fences for Gary Moore, reaching a peak rating of 107 in 2021 but he's won three of his seventeen starts in points since joining this yard, most recently a conditions contest by 15l at Parham in March; those weren't strong contests but he's likely to play a part.

2:10.race_name: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
2:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Londoner
runners.comment: Penalised for last week's AW win but still has handicapping scope; strong contender
runners.spotlight: He was having just his second run for this stable when rewarding strong market support at Newcastle nine days ago (1m2f, AW); 5lb penalty still leaves him with handicapping scope and he's a leading contender.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden
quotes.quote: Seamus was very happy with Londoner. He'll be a nice horse for next year and will probably start off at a mile and a quarter. - Chris Armstrong, stable's rep.

stable_tour.quote: He ran okay in a Derby trial at Leopardstown and could run in the Golden Gates on the final day. He seems well in himself at home. 15-06-23

runners.name: Wadacre Gomez
runners.comment: Better on AW than turf but handicapped as such; easy lead possible; can't ignore
runners.spotlight: Better on AW than turf and he was out the back at Chester 12 days ago on his return to grass; this is far less competitive though and he has a lowly mark to exploit, so can't discount, especially with the possibility of an easy lead.

quotes.race: Leading Environmental Solutions Handicap
quotes.quote: Wadacre Gomez is very straightforward and I'm a passenger really on him. The hardest part is getting him out of the gates and from then on, he pretty much does it himself, sets his own fractions. The Johnston horses have that tough trait in them and they keep going when they need too - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Robbo
runners.comment: Retains all his ability and appeals as the type to be winning soon; should stay this far
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in his four runs for this stable but he's shaped as though he retains all his ability; upped to 1m2f at Windsor last month in a slowly-run race and he didn't get a clear run at it when trying to launch a challenge; type to pop up soon.

stable_tour.quote: He's been training nicely. He was placed over six furlongs last season but we'll look to run him over seven soon. He's definitely shown enough to think he can win races. 17-04-24

runners.name: Gincident
runners.comment: Four solid runs for new stable, including over C&D; new accessories combination; contender
runners.spotlight: Made a winning start for James Owen in a 7f handicap at Leicester (good to firm) last month; not beaten far into third in three runs since, including when upped to this trip over C&D ten days ago; hood and tongue-tie have been worn independently of late and now are worn together; should run well again.

runners.name: Sugarloaf Lenny
runners.comment: Not found his very best stuff so far this year; down in trip and on his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Three wins last year, with one on turf (1m2f, good to firm) and two on AW (1m4f); on his last winning mark but needs to raise him game a notch now dropping back in distance.

quotes.race: Steve Watts 20yrs At Lingfield Park Handicap
quotes.quote: Sugarloaf Lenny got the mile and a half well today, which opens up a few more avenues. He's got an upward profile and the handicapper can't be too harsh, because he's only just winning - William Knight, trainer.

3:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Profit Refused

prev_owners.owner: Kevin Prendergast & Mrs J S Bolger

runners.comment: Well backed when making a winning stable debut last month; major player despite a 4lb rise
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish filly who was well backed ahead of her stable debut at Wetherby last month (7f, good to firm) and rewarded the support with a game front-running success; up 4lb but should be able to grab the stands' rail if desired and looks to have leading claims.

runners.name: Brasil Power
runners.comment: Four-time AW winner; yet to prove quite so good on turf, however, and others are safer
runners.spotlight: His four wins have all come on AW and he had been threatening on Polytrack prior to his disappointing return to turf at Ascot three weeks ago (1m, good to firm); he's better than that run suggests but this mark looks a bit high on the grass.

quotes.race: Unibet More Boosts In More Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Brasil Power was drawn 13 and George Boughey left it up to me. It was only in the stalls that I decided to drop him in and I'm surprised how quickly he got to the front. He's obviously a horse with ability and he likes the AW. It was a good performance - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a fun horse who could go to the All-Weather Championship Finals day. He's on a workable mark at the moment and I think he could be some fun through the summer. 07-04-25

runners.name: Under The Twilight
runners.comment: Dangerous mark and she's run respectably in both starts this year; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Six wins over shorter but should be fine at this trip; she has run with credit in two turf handicaps this spring and should capitalise on her reduced mark at some point soon.

quotes.race: Colin Ponting Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Under The Twilight likes Salisbury, but I don't know why. If it had been seven furlongs I wouldn't have run her. She's very gutsy and is a credit to herself - Michael Blake, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Epic Value Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't know what Under The Twilight would do on turf because all of her form is on the all-weather, but she's been keen around Wolverhampton and I thought a strong gallop would help her. I was adamant six furlongs was right. No-one else thought so, apart from David Probert, who has ridden her recently. A flat-out stiff six is perfect for her I think - Michael Blake, trainer.

runners.name: Urban Sprawl

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Good fourth at York last week; drops in trip/class with strong claims
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; successful on AW here (1m) last month off 1lb lower and held his form well on turf since, latterly finishing fourth of 14 in a strong York handicap last week (1m, good to firm); this is weaker and he is of obvious interest.

quotes.race: Victoria Racing Club Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I had no idea whether I'd won or not, but Urban Sprawl is game and he's in good form. He was really gunning for the line and he was able to stick his head down where it matters. He's tough - David Probert, rider.

quotes.race: Twickenham Nursery Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Nursery Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Urban Sprawl probably won't go to Carlisle on Thursday. I don't know what Darley will want to do with him. He's quite exposed for one of theirs and is what he is, but is very genuine and Andrea said he could go a bit further, which could be key in getting more out of him. I don't think ground matters to him - Mark Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: Yantarni
runners.comment: 2-2 at the track; back to a good mark and cheekpieces return; revival expected
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 7f on turf here last summer and also added a Newbury handicap last June off a 5lb higher mark; a trip to Bahrain was fruitless and he finished down the field at Ascot three weeks ago; the return of cheekpieces looks a big plus though and an improved showing is expected.

quotes.race: jenningsbet.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Yantarni was entitled to win like that on his previous form. He had a break after his all-weather campaign and has since been gelded. William said he thought this trip was as far as he wants to go just now - Alex Merriam, assistant trainer.

4:40.race_name: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Handicap
4:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Honour Your Dreams
runners.comment: In good form following wind op and last week's Windsor success was a snug one; good claims
runners.spotlight: Underwent wind surgery in January and he's returned from it in good form, placed at Chelmsford and Doncaster before a snug win at Windsor last week (5f, good to firm); no problem with the return to 6f and he's a strong contender despite his 5lb penalty.

runners.name: Last Outlaw
runners.comment: On a good mark but perhaps best at 5f; chance if building on recent stable debut
runners.spotlight: Both wins for Michael Wigham came over 5f and he looked stretched by this trip at Ascot on his recent stable debut; perhaps that run was needed but others might see this out better.

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: First time out at Doncaster I just let Last Outlaw find his feet early on and he ran on really nicely, despite hanging away from competition late on. I was confident he'd step forward from that and he was much more straightforward in the closing stages, though I'd expect him to come on again for that run - Sean Kirrane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Mart
runners.comment: Unplaced on last six starts but on a dangerous mark as a result; other pace in this field
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; did well initially for this yard and he's now 5lb lower than for the latest of his six wins; unplaced on his last six starts, however, and needs to raise his game a level if he's to exploit this mark; other pace on show here too.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Handicap
quotes.quote: The last three times Mart has been here, he's had such a bad draw, so today I said to Dylan [Cunha, trainer]: "I'm drawn out in the car park again, I'm just going to have to make the most of him" and I did well enough to get where I wanted. I thought I was beaten turning in but then he hit his last gear and motored home to win quite nicely - Rhys Clutterbuck, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Count Otto
runners.comment: Veteran who'd been absent for 439 days prior to a low-key return this month; down in class
runners.spotlight: Veteran; prolific winner down the years and he is on a lowly mark; had been absent for 439 days ahead of his Goodwood return 18 days ago (6f, good) and that should have blown away the cobwebs; drops in class this time but others look safer.

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Count Otto has been a legend for us. It's taken a couple of runs to get him back to himself after he had an injury last year, and I wasn't sure he was quite there yet, but it was great to see him win. He prefers a track with a turn so Lingfield suits him well. We'll look at the Sprint on Finals Day now and hopefully get him in the Stewards' Cup or consolation race at Goodwood in the summer - Amanda Perrett, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Count Otto is very consistent and it's nice that he's come here and won after a good winter on the all-weather. He must have fast ground so we could look at the consolation race for the Stewards Cup which he's run in a few times - Amanda Perrett, trainer.

quotes.race: 32Red.com Handicap
quotes.quote: For a little horse who can panic in the stalls, Count Otto is going the right way. Craig and Gary Witheford have done a good job, and the hood helps. We'll consider Good Friday, but he's still got ground to make up on the top horses in the Sprint and there are some nice 3yo handicaps on turf - Amanda Perrett, trainer.

quotes.race: 32Red Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: Count Otto is a bonny little horse and we've got the stalls (issue) sorted out now, as he was good again today. He'll hopefully improve with racing - Mark Perrett, husband of trainer Amanda

runners.name: Muscika
runners.comment: Prolific veteran who showed plenty of pluck to win at Redcar yesterday; can't be ignored
runners.spotlight: Veteran with 18 wins on his CV, the latest a narrow success at Redcar yesterday where he had his head down at just the right time (6f, good to firm); a penalty asks more of him but it was hard to fault either his attitude or enthusiasm yesterday.

quotes.race: Find More Big Deals At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Muscika is a lovely old boy. The last day at Epsom went really well and today went the same, he jumped out and has a nice gate speed, which is good from a low draw here. We went a nice enough gallop but I didn't have to use too much petrol and he travelled into it well. He's really found his form again - Cieren Fallon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Muscika jumped well and I got a very, very soft lead, surprisingly. We dawdled in front and then kicked and just nicked the race. He's an old boy, he's in good form and he was unlucky to get touched off at Wolverhampton the last day. He's handled the track very well. He's well balanced and he travels, which is what you need. He was true and honest to the line and I couldn't pull him up towards the end. Jockeys dream for rides like that where you jump out, bowl along and nothing catches you. It was like a piece of work and we never saw another rival - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extended Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always thought there was a good race in Muscika and he's proved it today. We might look at going back for the Great St Wilfrid after he finished fourth in it last year - Richard Walker, racing manager for owners Gallop Racing.

quotes.race: JW 4x4 Northallerton Handicap
quotes.quote: Muscika was dropped in last time and went a bit sour with it, so the boss said ride him handy. He travelled through the race great and quickened up before idling a bit when in front. He's a fine horse and hopefully there's more to come - Cam Hardie, jockey

quotes.race: Visit The Start Today Maiden Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Muscika is a nice big horse, but he is still a bit raw and green. He ran on well in the closing stages when the penny dropped. He may stay further but he could get quicker with racing - David O'Meara, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Won two nice races at York last year and seems to like the place. He's had some good runs this season and probably paid the price late on for going too fast at Ripon last time. He'll be kept going in the nice sprint handicaps, including at York. 10-05-21

4:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Sandscreendeliverd
runners.comment: Handicap/stable debut not so bad as a 7l defeat might suggest; check the market
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in three runs for Jamie Osborne as a 2yo; down the field when 40-1 for his stable/handicap debut at Windsor three weeks ago but he ran better than a 7l defeat might suggest, hanging left and weakening in the final furlong; interesting to see if he's more popular in the betting with that run behind him.

runners.name: Ghostman
runners.comment: 0-9 as a 2yo but often ran well in nurseries; returns from a break at a realistic level
runners.spotlight: 0-9 as a 2yo but often ran well in nurseries, runner-up twice at Newcastle (5f and 6f) in the autumn; returns from an absence at a realistic level; can't ignore.

runners.name: Virtue Temperance
runners.comment: Progressive at low level; better than bare result at Windsor latest; new cheekpieces here
runners.spotlight: Progressive at a low level and although she was only sixth at Windsor 15 days ago (behind Hello Luna), she wasn't seen to best effect; cheekpieces now added; stlll looks feasibly treated.

runners.name: Toolatetonegotiate
runners.comment: Runner-up in 3 of her last 4 starts; sharp test should suit; cheekpieces on for first time
runners.spotlight: Placed in six of her 11 starts and runner-up in three of her last four; should be suited by this sharp test and she won't need much improvement for the addition of cheekpieces to play a starring role.

runners.name: She Went Whoosh
runners.comment: Won an AW handicap here last month; less good on turf one week later; likely reviver
runners.spotlight: She wasn't winning out of turn when coming out on top in a 5f AW handicap here last month; not so good at Brighton one week later but she has run well on fast turf and holds each-way claims.

runners.name: Hello Luna
runners.comment: Encouraging 4th on handicap debut at Windsor two weeks ago; still has time to do better
runners.spotlight: Unexposed filly; showed bright speed on her handicap debut (visored first time) at Windsor two weeks ago but couldn't sustain her effort late on; could have a bigger effort in her.

runners.name: Flickas Girl
runners.comment: Came to hand early last year but she's generally struggled in handicaps; others look safer
runners.spotlight: Promising early 2yo but she's generally struggled since handicapping; not beaten far on her stable debut here (AW) in February but more will be needed to end her losing run.

stable_tour.quote: She was super impressive first time out at Wolverhampton. I was kicking myself after Bath as I shouldn't have run her there with a penalty and the track probably didn't suit her. The form of that race is unbelievable, though, as the winner [Betty Clover] has gone on to win the Marygate and the second [Englemere] has won twice since quite comfortably. She's a very honest filly who tries very hard, and just tries to do a little too much in the first half of a race. She was very good when second in the Lily Agnes as it looked a nice race. She's owned by a local guy from Wrexham, so she'll probably be campaigned around Chester and she looks tailormade for it. Six furlongs won't be a problem and there'll be plenty more days for her. The more experience she gets, the more she'll be able to mix it on different tracks. She could be one for the St Hugh Stakes at Newbury later on and she looks capable of picking up black type. 30-05-24

runners.name: Watkins
runners.comment: 11-race maiden; second to She Went Whoosh on AW here last month; others look stronger
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but he chased home She Went Whoosh on AW here last month and ran okay back on turf at Brighton one week later; needs more to break his duck.

3:10.race_name: Download The Racecourse App Raceday Ready Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands C/D) (GBB)
3:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Nanino Niyati
runners.comment: Hinted at ability on last month's Haydock debut (1m, good); can do better but she needs to
runners.spotlight: 50-1 for her Haydock debut (1m, good) last month, a run where she shaped with some promise but was ultimately well held; can leave that behind her in time.

runners.name: Neoma
runners.owner: Mrs S Russell & A M Russell
runners.comment: Runner-up on first two starts but ended 2024 with two heavy defeats; risky on return
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in fillies' maidens on her first two starts (7f, AW and 7.5f, good to firm); heavy defeats in her final two runs last year, however, and returns to action with a point to prove.

runners.name: Fantasmic
runners.comment: Shaped well on recent turf debut (1m, good) and can progress again over the extra furlong
runners.spotlight: Promise on her debut here (1m, AW) in March and she took a good step forward when third of eight at Goodwood on her turf debut 17 days ago; still green there but made some stealthy late headway, leaving the impression this trip would suit; can progress again.

runners.name: In A Hurry
runners.comment: 2nd in both starts, showing improved form at Ayr last month; should stay 1m1f; contender
runners.spotlight: Sent off favourite for a weak maiden (7f) at Newcastle last summer and ran creditably in second; better form when second of 14, beaten a neck, on her return to action at Ayr three weeks ago (1m, good); looked the winner when hitting the front in the final furlong but couldn't quite sustain the effort; should stay this far and she won't need much more to go one better.

runners.name: Life Is Rosie
runners.comment: Improved with each 2yo run; midfield on recent handicap/3yo debut; leading form claims
runners.spotlight: Improved with each 2yo run, recording an RPR of 72 when second of 11 behind a smart filly at Wolverhampton in November; only midfield on last week's reappearance/handicap debut but she should be sharper today and holds leading form claims.

runners.name: Nymphaea
runners.comment: 15,000gns half-sister to four winners, notably smart dual-purpose performer Nemean Lion
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; seventh foal; half-sister to four winners including Nemean Lion (Group-placed 1m4f Flat, RPR 104; smart 1m7f-2m4f hurdle), Nayala (German 8.5f/8.7f; 91) and No More Bolero (French 1m2f-12.5f); dam Listed-placed 1m1f winner (93); looks the part on paper and makes her debut at a realistic level; betting can guide.

runners.name: Peace First
runners.comment: Always behind on Bath debut last month (1m, good to firm); likely a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: 18-1, green and always in rear on her Bath debut last month (1m, good to firm); stamina on dam's side of her pedigree and may need even further than this.

2:40.race_name: Get Raceday Ready Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
2:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Cayman Dancer
runners.comment: Confirmed debut promise by making all on AW 12 days ago; sets the standard & more to come
runners.spotlight: Promising debut at Beverley last month and stepped up on that run when making all in a 1m2f maiden at Chelmsford 12 days ago; penalty to overcome but he sets the standard and remains capable of better; obvious chance.

runners.name: Persian Vision
runners.owner: John C Grant, J P M Oconnor & Partner
runners.comment: Well beaten in two 1m runs this spring; should stay but needs a good step forward
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two 1m turf runs this spring; should stay the new trip but improvement is a must.

runners.name: Burano Murano
runners.breeder: R P Philips & Chapel Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Modest form in two 1m2f runs five months apart; eyeshields off today; others stronger
runners.spotlight: Huge prices and he has finished out the back in two 1m2f runs 158 days apart (2yo run was for Denis Quinn); eyeshield worn at Windsor three weeks ago is now left off; improvement required.

runners.name: Wiz
runners.comment: 30,000gns half-brother to two winners; dam a useful 7f winner; hood/blinkers on for debut
runners.spotlight: 30,000gns yearling; half-brother to winners Star Of Orion (6f 2yo/7f; RPR 105) and Maywe (French 1m); dam 7f winner (90); enough paper appeal to warrant a market check but the fitting of a hood and blinkers for his racecourse debut sounds a note of caution.

runners.name: Percys Daydream
runners.comment: Promise but just modest form in two fillies' maidens seven months apart; can do better
runners.spotlight: Modest form in two fillies' maidens seven months apart (8.6f, AW and 1m2f, good); ought to be capable of better at some point and more minor money should be forthcoming.

2:32.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Stayers Qualifier) (GBBPlus Race)
2:32.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 2.32 +24yds and 3.32, 4.02, 4.32 & 5.05 +18yds)

runners.name: Godsend
runners.comment: Progressive last term and is 4-6 in handicaps; respected on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Looked a classic Prescott improver last term and justified favouritism in three-runner race at Pontefract (2m1f) final start, taking handicap record to 4-6; respected on reappearance, assuming the progress continues.

quotes.race: Napoleons Casino Bradford Handicap
quotes.quote: Godsend clearly stays well and a gorgeous, big, imposing horse. You'd like to think he could develop into a better four-year-old stayer. Hopefully there are going to be some big days in him in the future. He's been busy, I'm sure Sir Mark has got a plan but I guess at some stage he'll probably need a little breather - Luke Morris, jockey.

runners.name: Weddell Sea
runners.comment: In very good form on Newcastle AW this year; 0-17 in Flat turf contests
runners.spotlight: Ran well from out of the weights in warm race on Good Friday when bidding for a Newcastle (2m, AW) hat-trick; returns to an easier level but has more to prove than his rivals, being 0-17 in Flat turf contests.

runners.name: Toby Tops
runners.comment: Progressive this spring and latest win took his 2m form figures to 6111
runners.spotlight: Progressive this spring (maiden previously) and won at Ascot most recently, proving suited by the step back up to 2m and taking his form figures over this trip to 6111; he's 1-1 under Billy Loughnane; strong claims.

4:02.race_name: Dine In Sherwoods Restaurant Fillies' Handicap (Jockey Club Middle Distance Qualifier) (GBBPlus)
4:02.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 2.32 +24yds and 3.32, 4.02, 4.32 & 5.05 +18yds)

runners.name: Ciara Pearl
runners.comment: On a career-high mark but was successful in most recent attempt in a fillies' handicap
runners.spotlight: Came up short in Listed grade over C&D three weeks ago; has to overcome a career-high mark but was successful at Newmarket (1m2f) in most recent attempt in a fillies' handicap and can't be dismissed.

quotes.race: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: You never know with the ground until they've run. Ciara Pearl has won on soft, but not that sort of ground. She had a chance and I didn't think the first two would pull that far clear of the rest of the field - Daniel Kubler, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
