quotes.quote: Ciara Pearl was very green first time out at Bath and speaking to Cieren (Fallon) this morning, who rode her, he said the mile would probably be her minimum trip at the minute. Around that top bend we were getting slower and slower but she's just got one big stride and that's why I wheeled out and let her use her stride down the hill and she stayed on strongly - Jack Mitchell, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She's quite a big, leggy, frame of a filly. We bought her because she's a half-sister to Zulu Girl, who did well for us, and we knew it was a family who get to their best at four. It wouldn't be madness to think of black type for her following her pleasing win at Bath on Sunday. 02-05-24

runners.name: Mrs Twig
runners.comment: Seasonal debutante; record of 4-8 last term included a reappearance win
runners.spotlight: The only seasonal debutante in this field but her record of 4-8 (AW/turf) last term included a reappearance win; stiff task in Listed grade on final outing and this is more suitable.

quotes.race: Turners Of Soham Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: They went a good gallop, which helped, and I followed the Godolphin horse through. Mrs Twig stays very well which helped her - winning rider Tyler Heard

quotes.race: Stradivarius First Foals 2024 Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We've come here expecting to win and once Tom (Marquand) dropped Mrs Twig in the result was not in doubt. We came here from the prize money and she's a fast improving filly - William Muir, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Manara
runners.comment: Has form figures of 11122 since handicapping, running well at Brighton most recently
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 11122, mostly on AW, since handicapping; ran well, beating all bar the market leader, at Brighton (1m2f) returned to turf most recently; edging up the weights but looks a solid contender.

runners.name: North Star
runners.comment: Didn't live up to expectations on reappearance but remains of interest; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: AW novice form features a 7f win last autumn; didn't live up to expectations on reappearance (1m) but may do better with the outing under her belt; bred to stay this new trip; remains of interest.

stable_tour.quote: She was a bit disappointing at Southwell under a penalty as I thought she'd take the beating that day, but she came back and she was heavily in season, so she's had a break. I'm glad there was something to excuse her below-par effort because her work was decent and I'm looking forward to seeing her make her turf debut in the next few weeks. 07-04-25

runners.name: Bowerchalke
runners.comment: Won her final start in 2yo maidens; seemed to need reappearance run; may do better still
runners.spotlight: Scored at Kempton (1m, AW) on final start in 2yo maidens; easy to back and seemed to need her Wetherby reappearance run; will stay 1m2f if taking after her parents; may do better still.

runners.name: Castro Aurum
runners.owner: Only Fillies Racing Club, R Pocock, Hcs
runners.comment: Took well to first-time cheekpieces in Bath maiden on reappearance; may build on that win
runners.spotlight: Took well to first-time cheekpieces in Bath maiden (1m) on seasonal debut; may build on that success and show progress in the retained headgear, upped further in distance; possibilities off bottom weight.

5:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 2.32 +24yds and 3.32, 4.02, 4.32 & 5.05 +18yds)

runners.name: Man Of La Mancha
runners.comment: Solid in novices; comfortably ahead of opening mark at Windsor last week; highly respected
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in AW novice events won by useful sorts who have boosted the form; proved comfortably ahead of his opening mark in Windsor handicap (1m, good to firm) last week; incurs a penalty but Jack Dace takes off 7lb; the type to improve further anyway; highly respected.

runners.name: Zarathos
runners.owner: J Sarkar, D Sarkar, O Sarkar & D Sarkar
runners.comment: Six-race maiden; proving consistent; went close over C&D two starts ago; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who is proving consistent; short-head second over C&D (good) and very close third at Doncaster (1m, good to firm) since switched to turf from AW; up another 2lb but is threatening to win a race of this nature; solid chance.

runners.name: War Howl
runners.breeder: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
runners.comment: Ran encouragingly at Newcastle on debut for new connections; should build on that effort
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden; sold out of Brian Meehan's yard for 20,000gns after final 2yo start; shaped encouragingly at Newcastle (7f, AW) on debut for shrewd new connections and is likely to build on that effort; dam's side suggests he'll stay this new trip; shortlisted.

runners.name: Flagon Dry
runners.comment: AW win on final start in 2yo maidens; creditable third in Ripon handicap on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Steady progress in 2yo maidens culminated in narrow success at Southwell (1m, AW); creditable third in Ripon handicap (1m, good) on reappearance; place possibilities off same mark.

runners.name: Herculeus
runners.comment: Good second in Windsor maiden on reappearance; further progress is not implausible
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; good second in Windsor maiden (1m, good to firm) three weeks ago, improving on his heavy-ground 2yo efforts; going one better requires further progress, which is possible.

runners.name: Everyoneknowsadave
runners.comment: Dual AW scorer; ran creditably on turf last time but likely needs to show improvement
runners.spotlight: Couple of AW wins for previous yard; creditable fifth, despite a tardy start, over 1m at Doncaster most recently (second run for new stable); however, likely needs some improvement to open his turf account.

runners.name: Hot Dancer
runners.breeder: Minster Stud And Mrs H Dalgety
runners.comment: Placed in four of his five outings; creditable third at Doncaster latest; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Proving a consistent sort, having been placed in four of his five outings; creditable third at Doncaster (1m, good) latest, leading over 3f out until inside the final 1f; each-way claims off the same mark.

runners.name: Darn Hot Mystery
runners.comment: Open to progress but market may prove best guide; lacks 2025 practice, unlike her rivals
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in three 7f AW races last year, best RPR when going close the second time; open to progress in handicaps but market may prove best guide to expectations; lacks 2025 practice, unlike her rivals.

runners.name: Oceans Charm
runners.comment: Seemed to need latest run (back from break); heed the market signals now handicapping
runners.spotlight: Best novice effort when second at Southwell (1m, AW); seemed to need the run at Windsor two weeks ago when back from a break on debut for new yard; heed the market signals now handicapping.

4:32.race_name: Family Fun Raceday Sunday June 1st June Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
4:32.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 2.32 +24yds and 3.32, 4.02, 4.32 & 5.05 +18yds)

runners.name: Elzour
runners.comment: Has achieved nothing in bumper and 7f AW maiden
runners.spotlight: Has achieved nothing in bumper and 7f AW maiden, finishing last of five both times.

runners.name: My Mate Charlie
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival in bumper and Flat event for Julia Feilden
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival in bumper and Flat event (1m) last year for Julia Feilden; now wears tongue-tie; no form clams.

runners.name: Desert Shadow
runners.comment: Godolphin colt; ran well (clear second) in AW contest most recently; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Godolphin colt who ran well at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW; clear second) most recently, improving on his two Meydan efforts; leading contender returned to turf.

runners.name: Earthwatch
runners.comment: Signs of ability over 1m at Redcar while shaping as if this longer distance will suit
runners.spotlight: Only fourth of five in 1m contest at Redcar but showed signs of ability while shaping as if this longer distance will suit; open to improvement.

runners.name: Golden Handshake
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.comment: Down the field at Yarmouth, having been easy to back and seemingly in need of the run
runners.spotlight: Royal runner; down the field in 1m maiden at Yarmouth, having been easy to back and seemingly in need of the run; may do better.

runners.name: Native Spirit
runners.comment: 200,000gns yearling; by Ghaiyyath out of a 1m winner for his connections; interesting
runners.spotlight: 200,000gns yearling; by Ghaiyyath out of a 1m winner (RPR 88) for his connections; interesting debutant, especially if strong in the betting.

runners.name: Serenity Blue
runners.comment: Showed promise with his fifth-place finish at Leicester and looks open to progress
runners.spotlight: 360,000gns yearling; unraced for Sir Michael Stoute; showed promise with fifth-place finish, keeping on, at Leicester (1m2f) and looks open to progress; possibilities.

runners.name: Tenability
runners.comment: Frankel half-brother to a 7f winner; one of two newcomers in the field; market helpful
runners.spotlight: Frankel half-brother to 7f winner Tiaraqueen (RPR 92), out of 7f/1m winner (96); one of two newcomers in the field; market informative.

runners.name: Only One Blue
runners.comment: Started favourite and showed ability in 1m AW races during the winter; remains of interest
runners.spotlight: Beaten favourite in 1m AW races during the winter but showed ability, beaten just under 1l both times, and gave the the impression this longer trip will suit; remains of interest.

3:32.race_name: Harkila Trust Your Instinct Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
3:32.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 2.32 +24yds and 3.32, 4.02, 4.32 & 5.05 +18yds)

runners.name: Andersen
runners.comment: Well behind Hymnbook at Wetherby, failing to back up his Chelmsford effort
runners.spotlight: Well behind Hymnbook over 1m at Wetherby, failing to back up his Chelmsford 1m2f effort; needs improvement to get involved and may be more interesting in handicaps shortly.

runners.name: Displaying
runners.comment: Modest third at Windsor on reappearance but could take another step forward
runners.spotlight: Only a modest third, no match for the first two, at Windsor (1m, good to firm; carried head high) on reappearance but is nicely bred and could well take another step forward; shortlisted.

runners.name: High Degree
runners.comment: Too Darn Hot colt; Irish Derby entry; major yard; interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: Too Darn Hot half-brother to US 1m-1m1f winner Technical Analysis (including Grade 2; RPR 118), out of 1m/1m2f winner (97); Irish Derby entry; major yard; interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Hymnbook
runners.comment: Heading in the right direction; solid second at Wetherby most recently; respected
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 832 reflect that he's heading in the right direction; solid effort, narrowly beaten by a subsequent scorer, at Wetherby (1m, good to firm; turf debut) most recently; respected.

runners.name: Kings Charter
runners.comment: Form last summer has received several boosts; gelded since; leading player
runners.spotlight: 550,000euros foal, 650,000euros yearling; useful pedigree; made the frame at Sandown (7f) and Newbury (1m) last summer, and the form has received several boosts; gelded since; leading player on reappearance.

runners.name: Raedwald
runners.comment: The type to shine in handicaps soon; held by King's Charter on debut form
runners.spotlight: Couple of seventh-place finishes give him the look of one who'll find better opportunities in handicaps shortly, and he's held by King's Charter on debut running; needs to improve.

runners.name: Soho Legend
runners.comment: Always behind in 1m maiden at Yarmouth, having been friendless in betting
runners.spotlight: Closely related to a 1m4f Group 2 winner for his connections; always behind in 1m maiden at Yarmouth, having been friendless in the betting, and may need further.

runners.name: Zaramara
runners.comment: Showed some ability at Yarmouth and shaped as if this longer trip will suit
runners.spotlight: Related to a few winners for her yard; duly showed some ability with fourth-place finish, albeit comfortably held, in small field at Yarmouth (7f); shaped as if this longer trip will suit.

3:02.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watered) (Outer track) (Rail Movements: 2.32 +24yds and 3.32, 4.02, 4.32 & 5.05 +18yds)

runners.name: Antiphon
runners.comment: Thrown in on last summer's form; down in grade and can't be discounted
runners.spotlight: Finished fourth in the Dash on Derby day last June off a 32lb higher mark; struggling for best this year but too much ability to discount at this level and Tom Marquand a positive booking; visor experiment quickly aborted.

quotes.race: Star Property Group Handicap
quotes.quote: Antiphon is a legend of a horse, just so easy to train and he's run seven times for us since we bought him in February and he hasn't been out of the winner's circle. From where we were stood on the stands it looked like we'd been touched off, but he's so tough - Michael Keady, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely colt who made a pleasing debut when third at Newmarket's Craven meeting over 5f. Unfortunately, he had a niggly issue subsequently and will not be out for a while. He looks a proper hardy two-year-old. He will be back later this summer. 19-05-21

runners.name: Jamie Bond
runners.comment: Met all sorts of trouble at Catterick last week; this could be run to suit; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Poor strike-rate and down the field in two runs back on turf this spring; latest Catterick effort easy to forgive though as he got it wrong at the start and then saw no daylight in the home straight, finishing with running left in him; this should be run to suit and he's handicapped to go well.

runners.name: Snow Berry
runners.comment: Conditions to suit and on a good mark; back from a break but there are positives
runners.spotlight: Has a good record at the track, winning three times (twice last summer), and she's 4lb lower than for her Bath win last September; not at her best when last seen but there are positives on this return from four months off.

runners.name: Masterclass
runners.breeder: Julia Scott, J F Dean, M L W Bell
runners.comment: On a lowly mark and likely to pop up soon; he'll need a pace collapse over 5f though
runners.spotlight: His lowly mark should be well within range and while his first two runs after wind surgery haven't hinted at a full revival, he looks the type to pop up soon; 5f plenty sharp enough but it's likely this will be strongly run and he should be finishing his race off well.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study "Confined" Apprentice Handicap (For horses Which Have Not Won In 2023)
quotes.quote: The plan was to take a lead on Masterclass and he picked up nicely when I asked him. He liked the ground and has a good attitude - Brandon Wilkie, jockey.

runners.name: Banana

prev_owners.owner: Scott Dixon Racing , M Mahony , L Bond

runners.comment: Belatedly off the mark at Bath two weeks ago; another good run back there latest; solid
runners.spotlight: 48th time lucky when winning at Bath a fortnight ago; ran another solid race when second back at Bath last week and although she's 2lb higher today, the return to a bare 5f will suit; other pace to deal with but she's clearly thriving and could have more to come on fast turf.

runners.name: Stroxx
runners.comment: Two wins this year and last week's Catterick second was a good run; solid contender
runners.spotlight: Two wins this year and he ran another good race in defeat when second at Catterick last week (5f, good to firm); runs off the same mark and his rider takes off a handy 5lb; contender.

runners.name: Dunnington Lad

prev_owners.owner: Chris Kiely Racing Ltd & J Stokes

runners.comment: Two Ripon wins last year; dangerous mark but yet to fire this year; tongue-tie returns
runners.spotlight: Won two 5f handicaps at Ripon last season (soft and good) and he's now 3lb lower than for the second of them; not found his best so far this year, however, and the tongue-tie now goes back on.

runners.name: Tilsworth Ony Ta
runners.comment: Five-time winner; knocking at the door this year but finished behind Banana last time
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner; threatening this year, most recently finishing third of eight at Bath two weeks ago (5f, firm; race won by Banana); unplaced in five visits to Nottingham but he's capable at this level.

runners.name: Marcus
runners.comment: Exposed maiden but travelled quite nicely after break at Southwell 19 days ago; e-w shout
runners.spotlight: 0-17; has shown enough to think he could win a small race and he travelled well at Southwell on his return to action 19 days ago; each-way shout.

runners.name: Gypsy Nation
runners.comment: Exposed 20-race maiden; needs more for today's drop back to 5f
runners.spotlight: Exposed 20-race maiden; retains some ability after his lengthy absence and dropping to 5f shouldn't be a big issue; others appeal more for win purposes though.

2:50.race_name: Grace & Dotty Fedoras And Feathers Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Jubilant
runners.comment: Quite stylish hurdle winner in February but yet to build on that performance; chase debut
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace for quite stylish hurdle win at Huntingdon (3m1f, good to soft; first-time tongue-tie) in February but has not built on that performance since; wore cheekpieces when last of five at Plumpton (3m1f, good) last month; goes without headgear on chase debut; has a point to prove.

quotes.race: Visit Huntingdon For Your Next Conference Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It looked as if Jubilant was always going to win and it's no surprise as we were waiting to run him over this sort of trip. We had to pull him out twice because of soft going, but he handled this ground which had dried out a bit. He could be a good spring horse before going chasing next season - James Owen, trainer.

runners.name: Halondo
runners.comment: Made low-key stable debut over hurdles but may yet come good for Dan Skelton
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner for Olly Murphy in 2023; well beaten on consecutive starts for Harriet Dickin at start of this year and made low-key stable debut last month but sports first-time cheekpieces for this chasing debut and may yet come good for Dan Skelton.

runners.name: Just Three
runners.comment: Has better chance at the weights now back in a handicap but career strike-rate is 0-20
runners.spotlight: Irish raider; 0-10 over fences and has same strike-rate over hurdles; not favoured by the weights when well-beaten last of three in recent Killarney beginners' chase and has better chance in this handicap but his record over the last year or so is not compelling.

runners.name: Ghost Hunter
runners.comment: Rewarded patient ride at Chepstow last month and remains lightly raced; good chance
runners.spotlight: Inexplicably swerved left and ran out here on stable/chase debut in March but made amends at Chepstow (3m2f, good; first-time cheekpieces/tongue-tie) last month, where he was held up a long way off the pace before keeping on strongly to lead after the last fence; only 2lb higher today and could still have a lot more to offer.

stable_tour.quote: He was there for a long way at Kempton last month but was in top gear in the closing stages and got a bit tired. I don't think I should have run him as he needs soft ground and a galloping track. He's a well-bred three-miler and this season is just about experience before we go over fences. He ticks all the boxes. 13-12-23

3:20.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Duke Of Luckley
runners.owner: Owners For Owners Duke Of Luckley
runners.comment: In excellent form in the autumn; six-month break may have checked his momentum
runners.spotlight: In excellent form when last seen in the autumn, making all to win comfortably on good ground over C&D and at Catterick (2m3f); further progress is possible this year but six-month break may have checked his momentum.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Duke Of Luckley loves it around Southwell and takes some stopping from the front there. James [Best] gets on well with him and you have to be brave on him. He'd been a frustrating second at Worcester the last twice, being collared late on having run his heart out, but Southwell suits him better and he's a consistent horse. - Martin Keighley, trainer.

runners.name: Jetronic
runners.breeder: E B De La Motte & J B De La Salle
runners.comment: Ran well when third at Newbury in March and has good claims in this easier race
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent for new stable last season but ran well before fading into third in first-time cheekpieces at Newbury (2m, good) in March and has good claims in this easier race if the headgear continues to aid.

stable_tour.quote: A horse with a big future. I was thrilled with his run in a novice chase at Cheltenham the other day, behind a decent Irish horse. It was only the fourth run of his life and on the fastest ground he'd ever encountered. We'll stay chasing for now as he remains a novice over fences until December 1, and he'd be a possible for the Coral Gold Cup meeting at Newbury. After that we have the option of going novice hurdling. 05-11-23

runners.name: El Muchacho
runners.comment: Made an encouraging stable debut last month and remains well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Returned from spell in Germany with an encouraging stable debut at Chepstow last month, where he travelled strongly in rear before keeping on steadily for third; remains well handicapped and will be dangerous if that recent outing brought him on.

quotes.race: David Slater Big 7-0 Birthday Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've only had El Muchacho for a couple of weeks and we're learning about him all the time, but fair play to Bradley, he gave him a very good ride, and his jumping was impeccable - Harriet Dickin, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing Again 25th January Handicap Hurdle (Go North Sea Pigeon Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I thought  El Muchacho was going to win easily enough then the second horse picked up quite well when I got to him. I was a little bit short of room on the rail. He's a nice horse, Milton's done well with him and he's obviously progressed - Harry Cobden, rider.

runners.name: Harel Du Marais
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner for new stable in March; still in good form; respected
runners.spotlight: Has a tendency to race a bit too freely but started off for the Pogson stable with two C&D wins (both on good to soft) in March and returns here after close second in three-runner race at Huntingdon (2m, good) 12 days ago; respected.

runners.name: Asian Star
runners.comment: Course winner over hurdles; Dan Skelton is evidently keen to switch her to fences
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage mare who won a novice hurdle here (2m, good) in October; pulled up here on handicap debut the following month (bled from the nose) and not seen again since but Dan Skelton is evidently keen to launch her chasing career; market may guide.

stable_tour.quote: She left behind a very disappointing first run at Newton Abbot to win very easily next time out. She needs a faster-run race than the one she was beaten in last time at Warwick. We're finding out about her all the time and I think there are plenty more races to be won with her. 12-11-24

4:20.race_name: Bloomfields Horseboxes Mares' Maiden Hurdle (Arc Summer Novices' Brush Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB)

runners.name: Klervia
runners.comment: Kept on for modest third on hurdle debut at Newton Abbot; has place claims again
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in two points during the winter but kept on to take modest third in recent Newton Abbot novice hurdle (2m1f, good) for new stable and has place claims again if able to build on that performance.

runners.name: Taktique Gagnante
runners.comment: Placed in big-field Cork bumper in January; makes hurdling debut in a modest race
runners.spotlight: Changed hands after creditable third in 16-runner Cork bumper (yielding to soft) in January and was not disgraced in good-ground Cheltenham bumper for new stable last month; makes hurdling debut in a modest race; likely contender.

runners.name: Burgeon
runners.comment: Showed nothing more than minor promise on first two hurdling starts
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on last summer's Flat debut and showed nothing more than minor promise in two maiden hurdles (both 2m, good) for new stable this spring.

runners.name: Christian Bruce
runners.comment: Just a modest third at Kempton in March but shortlisted in this easier race
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability on the Flat for William Haggas last year and on her two hurdling starts for Alan King in February/March; only fourth best on merit when modest third at Kempton (2m, good) on latter occasion but this race is easier and she's on the shortlist; hooded for first time.

runners.name: Global Hideaway
runners.comment: First of her two runs in the autumn makes her one of the leading form contenders
runners.spotlight: Out of a useful hurdler for these connections; slightly disappointing when last of four at Newcastle in November but made quite encouraging debut when keeping-on fourth of seven in junior hurdle at Bangor (2m, good to soft) earlier that month and is one of the most interesting ones here.

runners.name: Hope Rising
runners.comment: In process of running well until bad jumping error cooked her goose on hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Showed some fair form (albeit without winning) on the Flat last year and was seemingly in process of running quite well until shocking jumping error at third-last flight cooked her goose on recent stable/hurdle debut at Warwick; can feature.

runners.name: Lasting Love
runners.comment: Fairly useful on the Flat; needs to learn to settle better over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful form when placed four times over 1m2f on the Flat for Andrew Balding last year; raced too freely on her first two stable/hurdle starts, easily brushed aside by short-odds winner when remote second at Stratford (2m, good) this month, but there is still hope she might transfer more of her Flat ability to this code.

runners.name: Nini Star
runners.comment: Pulled up on hurdle debut and didn't achieve much when sixth at Worcester recently
runners.spotlight: Fair on the Flat on her going days but was pulled up on stable/hurdle debut in February and probably didn't achieve much when sixth at Worcester (2m, good; first-time cheekpieces) a fortnight ago.

runners.name: Grandads Cap
runners.comment: Unexposed 5yo who moves up in trip for handicap debut; market may guide
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 5yo who showed minor promise over 2m on rules debut in November; unseated rider in Cheltenham Grade 2 on next outing and struggled on heavy ground last time but moves up in trip for this handicap debut and remains an unknown quantity; hood added; market may guide.

runners.name: Leading Force

prev_owners.owner: D & D Armstrong Ltd & L Westwood

runners.comment: Out of form towards end of last season but new trainer usually does well with new recruits
runners.spotlight: Good-ground chase winner for Sandy Thomson at start of last season; out of form over hurdles for him when last seen in February/March and has since changed hands for £9,500; back up in trip with headgear removed for this stable debut; new trainer usually does well with new recruits.

stable_tour.quote: I think there's plenty more to come from him. I know we've had him for a while but we're still working out his best trip. After his run over 2m4f at Newcastle last week, it's clear he needs further. We've had his wind done and he ran a really nice race on his comeback. He'll go over 3m next time and he also needs good ground, so we'll have to find the right race for him. 22-01-25

runners.name: Micronormous
runners.comment: Has rather mixed record last season but reverts to hurdling on a good mark; a possible
runners.spotlight: Had rather mixed record over hurdles/fences last season and was well held when second in small-field chase on latest outing in March but was given another wind op last month (her second) and reverts to hurdling on a good mark and with conditions suitable.

runners.name: Moonshine Girl
runners.comment: Shaped well before fading into fourth at Cork last week; still unexposed over 3m
runners.spotlight: Irish raider; 0-6 over hurdles but shaped well before fading into fourth at Cork (3m, good) ten days ago and remains unexposed over this trip; one to consider.

runners.name: Indian Sunbird
runners.comment: Won at Worcester last summer and ought to be back at concert pitch for third run this year
runners.spotlight: Bettered poor reappearance run when fifth of eight at Huntingdon (3m1f, good) this month and is now only 1lb higher than when causing 20-1 surprise at Worcester (2m7f, good) last summer; may well be the answer.

runners.name: Lizzie Rey
runners.comment: Caused 33-1 surprise over C&D in first-time cheekpieces in March; pulled up since
runners.spotlight: Given significant boost by first-time cheekpieces when causing 33-1 surprise over C&D (good to soft) in March but was pulled up after jumping poorly on next outing and it's hard to know what to expect from her today.

runners.name: Moro Rock
runners.comment: Back hurdling after unseating rider on chase debut; others have less to prove
runners.spotlight: Looked held when unseating rider here on last month's chasing debut and now quickly reverts to hurdling; quite well handicapped if judged on last year's Market Rasen second (2m7f, good) but riding arrangements suggest Indian Sunbird is the stable's main hope today.

runners.name: Foxs Socks
runners.breeder: E A R L Pestour, C Pestour & N Pestour

prev_owners.owner: The Lost My Socks Racing Syndicate

runners.comment: Kept on well for second this month, after a break, but overall profile not appealing
runners.spotlight: 1-19 over hurdles; stuck to his task pretty well when second at Huntingdon (3m1f, good) this month, after a break, and has obvious each-way claims if in similar form here but his overall profile is not appealing.

stable_tour.quote: I like him and he should have won a jumpers' bumper at Wolverhampton. He's coming along and loves his jumping. 09-11-20

runners.name: Stripe Of Honour
runners.comment: Out of sorts in the autumn but his record when fresh in recent years piques interest
runners.spotlight: Veteran who looked badly out of sorts when last seen in the autumn; 1lb wrong today and has a lot to prove but it's worth noting he won on good ground after a layoff in May 2023 and went close in this race (soft ground) when fresh last year.

4:50.race_name: Get The Inside Track With raceday-ready.com Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Runaway Train
runners.comment: Absent since poor run in January but his second here in November makes him of interest
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles and absent since a poor performance in January but his second of 13 here (2m, good) in November was a good effort and he could plausibly have untapped potential over this longer trip.

runners.name: The Last Drop
runners.comment: Not beaten far over 2m on handicap debut; may improve over this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in any of her three qualifying races in spring 2024 or when fifth of eight (just behind Dante's Inferno) on recent handicap debut at Uttoxeter (2m, good); no surprise if today's longer trip unlocks the necessary improvement.

runners.name: Macs Xpress
runners.comment: Did not show a great deal on his four appearances for Clare Ellam; now 0-27 over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Did not show a great deal on his four appearances for Clare Ellam last season and is now 0-27 over hurdles; difficult to enthuse over.

runners.name: Grasshopper Time
runners.comment: Reverts to hurdling on a workable mark but does not have a compelling profile
runners.spotlight: Pulled up after sketchy round of jumping on chasing debut in February and now reverts to hurdling; given a chance by the handicapper in this sphere but his record is not compelling and he has raced mainly on ground slower than good.

runners.name: Dantes Inferno
runners.comment: Worth another crack at 2m4f but was just a respectable fourth over 2m on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Looks worth another crack at today's trip but was just a respectable fourth on recent handicap debut at Uttoxeter (2m, good) and needs improvement.

runners.name: Dartmouth Rose
runners.comment: Second of five when upped to 2m4f for recent handicap debut at Fakenham; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Looked suited by the step up in trip when keeping-on second of five on handicap debut at Fakenham (2m4f, good) a fortnight ago and features prominently in calculations.

runners.name: Far Away West
runners.comment: In contention for second before last-flight fall at Kelso this month; a possible
runners.spotlight: 0-18 over hurdles but seemingly back in decent form on last two appearances; in contention for second before last-flight fall at Kelso (2m5f, good) a fortnight ago and has possibilities if that experience has not dented her confidence.

runners.name: Matchadam
runners.comment: Placed over 3m here on handicap debut in October; player if tuned up after break
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who posted a pretty good effort when third here (3m, good) on handicap debut in October; not seen again since but should be okay back at 2m4f and is open to further improvement if fully tuned up.

runners.name: Jackie Diamond
runners.comment: Still unexposed over hurdles but was safely held when 66-1 for recent handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Lowly rated Flat maiden; still unexposed over hurdles but was beaten about 22l when fifth of nine on recent handicap debut at Warwick (2m5f, good) and needs to take a good step forward here.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a wind operation and hopefully it may well have made the difference. She ran a nice race first time out and she'd always made a bit of a whistle so we decided to have her hobdayed. 21-09-23

runners.name: Mystic Man
runners.comment: Out of form for new stable since the autumn but still worth watching in betting market
runners.spotlight: Won four chases for others stables in 2023, three of them over 2m4f on good ground here; out of form over hurdles and fences for Ryan Potter since the autumn but has dropped to a low mark and is well worth keeping an eye on in the betting.

stable_tour.quote: I'd imagine he'll have a winter break at some stage. He's been amazing for the Bromleys this summer for Oliver Sherwood and me. He could go to Sedgefield next Sunday. He's been on the go for a long time and is due a holiday, which he'll have sooner rather than later. I'd imagine he'll have one more run. He's still in super form and he looks great. Hopefully he'll be back next summer. 18-10-23

runners.name: Noble Recall
runners.comment: Not beaten far in his first two handicaps but still makes only limited appeal
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in his first two handicaps (both over 2m4f on good ground this spring) and not as far out of the weights today but still makes only limited appeal.

3:50.race_name: Join Southwell Golf Club Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Beggars Nap
runners.comment: Half-brother to Grade 1 bumper winner Bellshill; among the most interesting ones
runners.spotlight: £22,000 3yo; 14th foal; half-brother to six winners including Bellshill (top-class bumper/jumps), Chieftain's Choice (useful bumper/hurdle) and Foxbridge (useful jumps); dam well held all three starts; interesting.

runners.name: Foxburrow Forever
runners.comment: Out of a 2m chase winner; stable not renowned for bumper success
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam 2m chase winner, closely related to useful jumpers Kayf Blanco and Land Of Vic; stable not renowned for bumper success.

runners.name: The Hustler
runners.comment: Pedigree does not leap off the page but his stable does pretty well in bumpers
runners.spotlight: £25,000 3yo; fifth foal; half-brother to a point winner; dam maiden pointer/hurdler, closely related to two winning jumpers; pedigree does not leap off the page but his stable does pretty well in bumpers.

runners.name: Wotalaad
runners.comment: Out of unraced half-sister to a Derby runner-up; rare bumper runner for his Flat stable
runners.spotlight: 1,800gns foal; third foal; dam unraced half-sister to 11.6f Listed winner/Derby second Dragon Dancer; rare bumper runner for Flat-oriented stable; market reference recommended.

runners.name: Atomic Sonic
runners.comment: Sister to stable's useful hurdler Get A Tonic; likely contender on paper
runners.spotlight: 10,000euros foal; 12th foal; sister to stable's useful hurdler Get A Tonic, half-sister to fair Irish hurdler Turfmans Daughter; dam Flat/hurdle winner; top stable has very good bumper strike-rate (20%).

runners.name: Eremenko
runners.comment: Closely related to stable's useful bumper/hurdle winner Doddiethegreat; must be considered
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; closely related to connections' useful bumper/hurdle winner Doddiethegreat, half-sister to winners Carrie Des Camps (useful bumper/hurdle) and Jimmy Jimmy (bumper/hurdle); dam bumper/jumps winner; represents a top stable and looks the part on paper.

runners.name: Mcflo
runners.comment: The only one of these with experience but didn't show a great deal on debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a bumper winner; the only runner in this line-up with experience but didn't show a great deal when seventh of nine at Fakenham (good; wore cheekpieces, as today) last month.

runners.name: No Tricks At All
runners.owner: M V Magnier, Mrs P Shanahan & Dash Grange Stud
runners.comment: Out of a French 1m2f Group 3 Flat winner; stable does well in bumpers; high on the list
runners.spotlight: 125,000euros 3yo; tenth foal; half-sister to four French winners under various codes; dam French 1m2f Group 3 Flat winner; stable does well in bumpers; high on the list.

5:15.race_name: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
5:15.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Raphello
runners.breeder: Newtown Stud And T J Pabst

runners.spotlight: Long losing run and no signs of a revival in a couple of recent starts.

runners.name: Art Of Unity

quotes.race: Troytown Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: He was very brave today and tried very hard. I told Leigh to bounce out and make every post a winning one. Art Of Unity skipped along and you could see him putting his old ears back in the last 100 yards. He tried his heart out. He had 8-6 there and Leigh is a good, strong rider. Leigh and Gary Halpin suit him as they are strong riders but unfortunately Gary couldn't do the weight today and Leigh was a good deputy. He'll go for the Joe McGrath at the Curragh now - Johnny Feane, trainer.

quotes.race: TRI Equestrian Handicap
quotes.quote: Art Of Unity got a nice easy lead and the tailwind helped him, as did the conditions - John Feane, trainer.

quotes.quote: He ran well the other day and was a little unlucky in getting lonesome on ground that probably was as slow as he wanted. Back to the five furlong trip here was ideal. He had a nice draw, handled the surface well and is a horse who probably doesn't really know how to sprint yet, as he was a little bit lost early doors. He'd probably be a nice little sprinter for Noel next year during the summer on good ground and they should have plenty of fun with him - Colin Keane, jockey

quotes.quote: If there was ever a horse who deserved a win it's Dark Viper. He's a stable favourite and a good lead horse. It wouldn't surprise me if he went in again - Shane Foley, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: After failing to get his head in front in his first 19 starts, he finally did it at Leopardstown the other day. I was beginning to wonder if he ever would but thank God he did. runners.name: Tastyee
runners.comment: Struggling over timber recently; best Flat effort in recent times have come over further
runners.spotlight: Struggling over timber recently and best Flat effort in recent times have come over further than this; looks vulnerable.

runners.name: Game Phoenix
runners.owner: Mrs B Power & John J Phelan
runners.comment: Has gone close over timber but yet to show enough on the level; likely to need further
runners.spotlight: Has gone close over timber but yet to show enough on the level; unseated on the Flat last time and suspicion she'll end up needing further than this trip in this sphere.

runners.name: Together Aclaim
runners.comment: 1-36 and sole win on AW; no signs of revival over similar trip at Sligo recently
runners.spotlight: Just 1-36 and that win came on AW; no signs of a revival over a similar trip to this at Sligo earlier this month.

runners.name: Deuteronomy
runners.comment: 27-race maiden whose better efforts have come over further than this
runners.spotlight: 27-race maiden whose better efforts have come over shorter than this.
